modules.description: This module provides direct conversions between `Unix.file_descr` and `uv_os_fd_t` types, handling platform-specific compatibility checks. It works with file descriptors and OS-specific handle types, primarily used in libuv and Unix system programming. Concrete use cases include adapting file descriptors for use with libuv APIs on non-Windows systems and ensuring correct handle types on Windows.

This module provides functions to convert between Unix file descriptors and libuv socket descriptors. It supports converting a Unix file descriptor to a libuv socket descriptor with `from_unix`, which may fail on Windows if the descriptor is not a valid socket, and converting a libuv socket descriptor back to a Unix file descriptor with `to_unix`. Use this when interoperating with low-level networking code that requires passing socket descriptors between Unix and libuv APIs.

This module handles conversions between Unix file descriptors and libuv-compatible types, specifically `uv_os_fd_t` and socket descriptors. It provides direct mappings through its `Fd` and `Socket` submodules, ensuring correct type handling across platforms. Use it to interface system-level file and socket descriptors with libuv-based libraries or system calls requiring specific descriptor types.

This module converts Unix file descriptors to libuv-compatible types, specifically mapping between `Unix.file_descr` and `uv_os_fd_t` or socket descriptors. It provides `Fd` and `Socket` submodules for precise type conversions, ensuring cross-platform compatibility. Use it when passing file or socket descriptors between OCaml code and libuv-based libraries or system APIs expecting specific descriptor types.
